review_text: These headphones have set a new standard for noise cancellation. On flights, they completely eliminate engine noise, and in offices they make it feel like you're alone. Sound quality is excellent with clear highs and deep, controlled bass. Comfort is outstanding for all-day wear. The 30-hour battery life means I only charge them once a week. Worth every penny!

As someone who flies weekly, these headphones have been a game-changer. The noise cancellation makes even long flights more bearable, the comfort allows me to wear them for 8+ hours without discomfort, and the battery life lasts for multiple long-haul flights. Call quality is also excellent for taking meetings on the go.

While these headphones sound great and the noise cancellation is impressive, they're significantly overpriced. The build quality doesn't feel premium enough for the cost - too much plastic. The touch controls are also finicky and often register accidental touches. Sound and ANC are excellent, but not worth the premium over competitors.

After years of Bose headphones, I switched to these and won't go back. The noise cancellation is noticeably better, especially for human voices in offices. Sound quality is more enjoyable with better bass response, and the app offers useful customization. The only downside is they don't fold as compactly as my old Bose headphones.

While these are consumer headphones, they're detailed enough for basic music production work on the go. The frequency response is relatively flat with EQ adjustments, and the noise cancellation helps focus in noisy environments. They're not a replacement for studio monitors or professional headphones, but they're versatile enough for both enjoyment and work.

These headphones prioritize comfort above all else, and it shows - I can wear them for 12+ hours without any discomfort. Noise cancellation is among the best available, particularly for consistent noises like airplane engines and air conditioners. Sound quality is good but not exceptional, with a somewhat conservative tuning that works well for most genres.

I've tried many noise cancelling headphones, and these remain the best specifically for air travel. The combination of excellent noise cancellation for engine noise, exceptional comfort for long flights, and good battery life make them ideal. Sound quality is pleasant though not audiophile-grade. The ability to connect to two devices simultaneously is very useful for switching between laptop and phone.

While these are possibly the most comfortable headphones available and the noise cancellation is excellent, the sound quality is disappointing for the price. The bass lacks definition, the mids are recessed, and the treble lacks sparkle. They're functional but not enjoyable for critical listening. Good for travel and office use, but not for music appreciation.

Working in an open office plan, these headphones have saved my sanity. They block out conversations, typing sounds, and HVAC noise effectively, allowing me to focus. The comfort means I can wear them all day, and the battery easily lasts a full workweek. Call quality is also excellent for virtual meetings.

While still very good headphones, the design and features are falling behind newer competitors. The noise cancellation remains excellent, but sound quality and features like multipoint connectivity and ambient mode are better implemented by Sony and Apple now. They're still the most comfortable for long sessions, which keeps them in my travel bag.

For those invested in the Apple ecosystem, these headphones offer an unmatched experience. The automatic switching between Apple devices is magical, spatial audio creates an immersive experience for movies, and the noise cancellation is among the best available. Build quality is exceptional with premium materials throughout. The sound is well-balanced and detailed.

These headphones are as much a fashion statement as they are audio equipment. The machined aluminum, premium mesh, and perfect weight distribution create a distinctive and luxurious product. Fortunately, they sound as good as they look, with detailed, balanced audio and excellent noise cancellation. The main drawbacks are the high price and the bizarre case design.

review_title: Great headphones crippled by ecosystem limitations
review_text: While these headphones sound excellent and the build quality is outstanding, they lose significant functionality outside the Apple ecosystem. No proper power button, limited controls, and reduced audio quality with non-Apple devices make them hard to recommend for Android or Windows users. They're also significantly overpriced compared to competitors with similar audio performance.

As an audio engineer, I was skeptical but impressed by these headphones. The frequency response is remarkably flat and accurate, detail retrieval is excellent, and the soundstage is impressively wide for closed-back headphones. The noise cancellation is useful in noisy environments, and the build quality inspires confidence for professional use. The main drawbacks are the high price and limited codec support.

These headphones deliver a luxury experience from unboxing to daily use. The materials feel premium, the comfort is excellent despite the weight, and the sound quality is detailed and engaging. The seamless integration with other Apple devices enhances the experience. However, the case is inexcusably bad for the price point, offering minimal protection and awkward design.

These headphones strike an excellent balance between audiophile sound quality and modern features like ANC and wireless connectivity. The sound signature is detailed and natural with a wide soundstage for closed-back headphones. Battery life is exceptional at 60+ hours. Noise cancellation isn't best-in-class but is more than adequate for most environments.

As an owner of previous Momentum generations, the sound quality remains excellent with Sennheiser's signature detailed mids and clear, non-fatiguing treble. However, the design has lost its distinctive character, now looking generic compared to the premium styling of previous models. Build quality also feels less premium with more plastic. Still recommended for sound quality, but the design is disappointing.

The 60+ hour battery life is not an exaggeration - I typically get through two full weeks of daily use before needing to recharge. This alone makes them worth considering, but fortunately they also sound excellent with a balanced, detailed presentation that works well for all music genres. Noise cancellation is good though not best-in-class. Comfort is excellent for all-day wear.

While the sound and battery life are excellent, the build quality is a significant downgrade from previous Momentum models. Too much plastic, less premium materials, and a generic design make these feel less special than they should for the price. They're still good headphones functionally, but the premium feel is gone.

These headphones don't excel in any single category but are good to very good in all of them. Sound quality is detailed and enjoyable, comfort is excellent for long sessions, noise cancellation is effective in most environments, and battery life is class-leading. They lack the distinctive design of competitors but make up for it with all-around performance. A safe recommendation for most users.

These open-back headphones are perfect for mixing and mastering work. The detail retrieval is exceptional, allowing you to hear every element in complex mixes. The frequency response is relatively neutral with a slight emphasis on highs that helps identify issues in recordings. Comfort is excellent for long studio sessions, and the build quality inspires confidence for professional use.

For critical listening at home, these headphones are outstanding. The open-back design creates a spacious soundstage, detail retrieval is excellent, and the slightly bright signature brings out nuances in well-recorded music. The velour earpads remain comfortable even after hours of listening. The only downside is the lack of isolation, making them unsuitable for noisy environments or travel.

While technically impressive with excellent detail retrieval and soundstage, the treble emphasis is too much for extended listening. Cymbals, sibilance, and high-frequency details become fatiguing after 30-45 minutes. Build quality and comfort are excellent, but the sound signature needs EQ to be enjoyable for long sessions.

For home recording and mixing, these headphones offer professional quality at a reasonable price. The detail and clarity help identify issues in recordings, the comfort allows for long sessions, and the build quality feels like it will last for years of daily use. They're not suitable for tracking due to the open-back design, but perfect for mixing and critical listening.

The spacious soundstage and detailed presentation make these headphones perfect for classical music. You can clearly hear the positioning of instruments in an orchestra and subtle details like fingers on strings or breaths from wind players. The comfort allows for enjoying long symphonies without adjustment, and the relatively easy drive requirements mean they work well with most sources. Not portable or suitable for noisy environments due to the open-back design.
